intro: Scabiosa transsilvanica, commonly known as the Transylvanian scabious, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its clusters of small, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, woodlands, and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. It produces distinctive, cylindrical flower heads and has hairy stems and leaves. Scabiosa transsilvanica is valued for its ornamental appeal and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
